tweets.text: Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa
Thank you @hfrs_control. Equipment from our @EnvAgency grab pack was also used to prevent any contaminated water running in to local water supply. https://t.co/w3ht8rRUeI https://t.co/p4hnGmCJvA
@Feargal_Sharkey @DormouseRoared @EnvAgency No wonder as many as a third of global freshwater fish are in danger of Extinction #worldsforgottenfishes https://t.co/3o5otzHnP8

Had a great spring day out on the Mimram selecting trees to drop into the river to aid sediment sorting, fish cover and bed scour. Bees and scarlet elf caps, it's not all trout. @HMWTBadger @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/DHGpvPNOau
@WindrushWasp @thameswater @EnvAgency @Ofwat @sandralaville @GeorgeMonbiot @robertcourts Tankering drinking water I can understand....but tankering sewage??

tweets.text: @60246023 @CanalRiverTrust @Edwina_Currie @robertlargan @EnvAgency @Natures_Voice So help us out and highlight this üëçüèª
@EnvAgency Thank you!

@FoxesAfloat looking at one of the pictures, it looks like there is petrol/diesel in the water ? Then this definitely needs reporting to our Incident team on 0800 80 70 60, or email  to Incident_Communication_Service@environment-agency.gov.uk
@EnvAgency Given that we believe the @CanalRiverTrust are mishandling this incident, which is leading to damage to boats and wildlife, is it something we can report to you, and if so how?
@FoxesAfloat just catching up on all the threads but its not showing all of them. We manage main water channels but not the canals however any water pollution will need investigating.
@EnvAgency Do you have any jurisdiction with CRT canals? Struggling to get an answer from the @CanalRiverTrust
@FoxesAfloat Water pollution in rivers and streams will need to be reported to our Incident team on 0800 80 70 60. free contact number 24/7.

@60246023 @CanalRiverTrust @Edwina_Currie @robertlargan @EnvAgency @Natures_Voice Dozens of people who live nearby can see it but the CRT say no evidence, that it's been cleaned up, there is no pollution passing your boat. Well, this was cleaned a couple of hours ago... https://t.co/CuYaPb8aQn

@FoxesAfloat @CanalRiverTrust @Edwina_Currie @robertlargan @EnvAgency @Natures_Voice Surely if the source is know why hasn‚Äôt it been stopped by now for crying out load,maybe this should be sent to the news channels

Tankering sewage around is cheaper than sorting out the causes and the failed sewage system @thameswater  The @EnvAgency and @ofwat condone it so the customer and environment take the hit @sandralaville @GeorgeMonbiot @robertcourts  This was a delivery TO Eynsham Oxon today. https://t.co/VTX0ALbYf1

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text: Object 59 #Defragroupin100objects:  Sample throw line. This equipment enables @EnvAgency to monitor water quality & safety for beachgoers at over 400 bathing sites in England. In 2019, up to 94% met the highest standard.  Cannot guarantee the temperature! https://t.co/FRVknPl5YB

@CertusCC @EnvAgency @RachSalv @JamesBevanEA The man that stated we don't allow people to discharge sewage into chalkstreams, then back tracked and said in extreme weather circumstances. Hmmm yep he has his finger on the ball.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Say this again. If the same amount of sewage flowed down each individual highstreets action would be taken, but a river it is deemed acceptable as people don't care, its not their problem. When we loose what we have remember you was warned. This really boils my p**s

tweets.text: Huge thanks to our contractors for helping us to establish much needed scrub along this beck in the Glenderamackin catchment - helping to #slowtheflow, provide habitat and create pockets of shade to keep watercourses cool when temperatures rise. Funded by #WEG and @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/5wXlf1uuAv

According with the Welsh Harp Joint Consultative Committee "some vegetation will be reduced on waterside to assist the regeneration of marshland". Plenty of rubbish has been found after the "scrub" and not been removed! Please #cleantheharp üôèüèª  
@NaturalEngland @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/1s0lZk9kel

There are still 3 #flood warnings and 11 flood alerts in place across #Cumbria this afternoon. Our teams are still out working to reduce flood risk

Are you prepared? Check the latest situation in your local area and sign up to our free flood warnings ‚¨áÔ∏è

https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/jCCAS4eJuu

tweets.text: @JamesBevanEA and @EnvAgency have made a classic mistake by not working with organisations and campaigners on shared aims like reducing riverine pollution. The constituency who the agency should count on to support them have been ignored - a strategic error https://t.co/uwxI2mbAws

@Feargal_Sharkey Back to the bad old 60s/70s when heavy industry discharge to rivers was common. As a keen schoolboy coarse fisherman in the 70s, I saw the price paid by freshwater fish. #backtothefuture with regular sewage discharge and farm runoff @EnvAgency? Wild swimming @trishgreenhalgh?

tweets.text:
Good idea for logging pollution incidents at https://t.co/FhmazZgd2r
Awesome chance for those who care to log what they observe. 
Sadly, since the regulator @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA has decided to chuck out pollution reports, who will do anything?
@Feargal_Sharkey
